page.title: 09LIVES MRS BRIGG MR MURRAY 2
page.content: Her mother ran a sewing class for the ladies of the village.She bought the bales of material and charged them a shilling a week.My stepfather was William Henry Green.He gave the statue of Lady Godiva to Coventry. I don't want the village spoilled. They have put up 64 signs in the village recently. Mr Murray - I was born in this house and I have lived here for 74 years. My dad lived all his life here too. We never left the village. I went to school here. The council bought the shoes for the kids who walked from Sheepy. I left school at 14, the year the school closed 1937. I went to work for Mr Dawkins in farming.He owned the land afore Corbett bought it when Dawkins sold up. I went to work at Pooley Colliery for 30 years. I don't leave the village very often.
